remarks: If two classes have the finite intersection property, then so does their intersection.  (Contributed by Richard Penner, 1-Jan-2020.)
statement:
fiinfi.a $e |- ( ph -> A. x e. A A. y e. A ( x i^i y ) e. A ) $.
fiinfi.b $e |- ( ph -> A. x e. B A. y e. B ( x i^i y ) e. B ) $.
fiinfi.c $e |- ( ph -> C = ( A i^i B ) ) $.
fiinfi $p |- ( ph -> A. x e. C A. y e. C ( x i^i y ) e. C ) $.
$d A x y $.
$d B x y $.
$d C x y $.
$d ph x y $.
